data.title: 1.3.1 doesn't save session on OSX 10.11.1
data.body:
I encounter an issue with project saving with Atom 1.3.1. Here's my config  :

```
"*":
  "exception-reporting":
    userId: "631146f8-69d1-b154-4734-012195c538f5"
  welcome:
    showOnStartup: false
  core:
    openEmptyEditorOnStart: false
  editor:
    invisibles: {}
    fontSize: 11
    backUpBeforeSaving: true
    showInvisibles: true
  pigments: {}
  "terminal-plus":
    core: {}
    style: {}
  "save-session":
    dataSaveFolder: "/Users/radev09/.atom/packages/save-session/projects"
```

Can't find any same issues. Does it comes from my config or is it an issue related to the OS or something else?

data.title: Infinite loop in TextEditor.getLongTitle() causes editor to hang
data.body:
`getLongTitle()` appears to be responsible for disambiguating the tab's title in the case of multiple tabs with the same file name. The code will hit an infinite loop when presented with a certain directory structure:

```
alpha/
  foo/
    bar.txt
beta/
  foo/
    bar.txt
  something-else/
    bar.txt
```

If all three `bar.txt` files are opened in Atom, when the third one is opened and `getLongTitle()` is called, it will hit an infinite loop.

The method takes the file path for the tab being opened, and compares it to the others already open. If it finds colliding base filenames (i.e. `bar.txt`), and attempts to find the first parent directory that differs by stripping off one segment from each file path, until it finds a unique directory. The problem is that by comparing the paths this way, one level at a time, you can have one path collide at one level, and another path collide at a different level, resulting in no unique directory for all paths being found.

The problem becomes apparent when we step through the logic while attempting to open `beta/foo/bar.txt` with the other two `bar.txt` files already open.
1. All three file paths are selected for disambiguation since they all have the same basename (`bar.txt`).
2. Strip one layer off (now at `beta/foo`), and check if the lowest directory is unique. It's not, because of `alpha/foo/bar.txt` (whose path is now `alpha/foo`, colliding with `beta/foo`).
3. Strip off another layer (now at `beta`), and check if the lowest directory is unique. It's not, because of `beta/something-else/bar.txt` (whose path is now `beta`).
4. Repeat, but now all the paths are the same because we hit the root of the project.

Eventually, all the paths are reduced to `/`, and the while loop gets stuck.

Happy to try submitting a PR, but feels like this could use some discussion about what the actual goal is. I'm not sure the current algorithm would work, even with a different implementation. There is no single ancestor directory that could disambiguate all three file paths, so it seems like a different approach is needed.

Here's a zip with a reproduction project:
[atom-bug-repro.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/61770/atom-bug-repro.zip)

data.title: Proposal: Add an "API Changes" section to change log information in Releases
data.body: With the huge glut of new information in the change log on Releases, it is unclear for package authors where they can go to get information specifically on API changes. We should create an "API Changes" section of all change logs to document any changes to APIs so that package authors can go one place to find such information without having to scour the entire change log.

data.title: Document contract that can be depended upon for Promises returned from Atom APIs
data.body: API documentation that simply states "returns a Promise" is somewhat ambiguous. We need to document exactly what operations are valid for any Promise returned from an Atom API.

data.title: New windows should be offset in mac
data.body:
Repro in Mac:
1. Drag a folder to Atom.
2. Drag another folder to Atom:

Observed: Second window opens on top of the first.
Expected: Second window is offset down and to the right by ~20px, and is smaller in each dimension by the same amount.

data.title: Can't seem to update Atom
data.body: I'm on version 1.3.0 on OSX El Capitan. When I click Restart and Update from the Atom menu, Atom closes but never re-opens. I've left it for over an hour and nothing seems to happen. I manually downloaded Atom from github and replaced my previous version and it's still showing version 1.3.0 and saying there's an update available. Any ideas what I can do?

data.title: Soft hyphen and Non-breaking space invisible when Invisibles are activated (OS X)
data.body:
The [Soft Hyphen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soft_hyphen) is a useful character. It should be visible when Invisibles are turned on.

Atom 1.2.4 on OS X 10.11.1

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. In Atom, turn on invisibles through the Shift+CMD+P menu and place the cursor where you want to insert the soft hyphen
2. Open the OS character window with Ctrl+CMD+Space
3. Search for the Soft Hyphen and double click on it to insert into Atom
4. Nothing happens
5. Open the file in another editor, e.g. TextWrangler. The hyphen is there.

data.title: ISO-encoded XML files open with wrong encoding
data.body:
The attached XML file declares and uses ISO-8859-15 as its encoding, but it opens as UTF-8. The sample Euro character (U+20AC), coded as byte 0xA4 in that encoding, is not shown correctly. Atom 1.3.1 on OS X 10.11.2.

![iso-8859-15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3627476/11778519/1b1780fa-a255-11e5-87e1-e94dc1268326.png)

[ISO-8859-15.xml.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/61041/ISO-8859-15.xml.zip)

data.title: pixelPositionForScreenPosition randomly returns invalid x position
data.body:
As you can see in the gif below, some of my markers views get invalid x coordinates when I modify the buffer:

![screen-position-issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/11777765/c08e151c-a250-11e5-9731-7027555b7257.gif)

In the gif above, the update of the views is scheduled on a new frame during the `did-change` event of the text editor. I have more or less the same result if I do the update immediately. And as far as I can tell it was still working properly last week.

data.body:

Nothing running but atom.
C++ project 

Tested with:

The problem happens with large projects using git and also with small folders with just a bunch of files ... but it is worst in the first scenario. It makes the (amazing) editor unusable ...

I have uninstalled and installed the `save-session` package multiple times, no luck.

This is version 1.3.1.

I'm guessing some file somewhere has these 3 files of mine saved and this file just never gets updated?

data.title: Atom hangs on opening multiple same name files with similar paths
data.body:
When trying to open multiple files with the same name but under slightly different paths, atom crashes.

**Reproduction Steps:**

**1**. Create the following folder and file structure outside of Atom. Files do not need to have any content.

```
root/
      folder1/ 
             sub1/
                  file.txt
             sub2/
                  file.txt
      folder2/ 
             sub1/
                  file.txt
             sub2/
                  file.txt
```

**2**. Open the folder `root` in Atom using File -> Open Folder
**3**. Open any three files by clicking on them in the Tree View

**Expected behavior:**
Atom opens up all three files in their own tabs

**Observed behavior:**
Atom editor stops responding on trying to open the third file, a few seconds later a dialog pops up asking to wait or close. Wait never resolves so closing is the only cause of action. The developer console shows no exception.

**Atom version:** 1.3.1
**OS and version:** Windows 7

**Installed packages:**
None

**Additional information:**
This bug occurs on a fresh install of atom with zero config changes or package installs.
I believe this has something to do with how the tabs are named with files that have the same name. 
When opening two files you get one of the following tab names
- `folder1\...\file.txt` | `folder2\...\file.txt`
- `sub1\file.txt` | `sub2\file.txt`

However when you open a third file, Atom doesn't know how to name the 3rd tab because if it tries to follow one of the formats above, it will have two files that have identical tab names. e.g.

`folder1\...\file.txt` (Meaning folder1\sub1\file.txt) | `folder2\...\file.txt` (Meaning folder2\sub1\file.txt) | `folder1\...\file.txt` (Meaning folder1\sub**2**\file.txt)
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: **Yes**
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: **Yes**
  - Can't reproduce this problem in 1.2.3 Windows 7 or 1.2.0 Linux Debian. It's worth noting that 1.2 formats the tab names differently (`file.txt - folder1\sub1`)
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: **Yes**
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: **Yes**

data.title: Atom crashing my computer
data.body:
Atom crashing my computer

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Go to the 'Settings menu'
2. Go to the 'Themes' tab
3. Change the theme by using any of the drop down menu

I was expecting it to change themes but then it shows an empty box with no themes indexed, no font visible, and then my computer freeze. I then have to manually restart it. It happens in safe mode too.

Atom version:   Atom 1.3.1
OS and version:   Ubuntu 14.04.3 with 'kernel 3.19.0-39'

**Installed packages:**

.deb from the main page of the atom website :  https://atom.io/

**Additional information:**
- Problem can be reproduced in safe mode: Yes
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes

data.title: Add Auto Indent shortcut
data.body:
Is it possible to add an Auto Indent shortcut just like in Netbeans IDE on windows (Alt + Shift + F)?

Thanks.

data.title: Add ability to save as default filetype
data.body: Add ability to save as default filetype. So I can set to ".html" and all files onwards will have the automatic extension .html appended to the filename when trying to save the file.

data.title: Atom 1.3.1 not responding when started with files/directories in the workspace
data.body: After 1.3.1 update. Running `atom .` from the shell will result in the message seen below, which never recovers from. Even starting it by clicking on its app icon (OS X) will result in the same situation. Only after several random attempts Atom will start with no files or directories on the workspace (only a blank, unnamed file) and will work normally.

data.title: Clear the require cache for a package files and dependencies
data.body: This is an attempt to fix the issues after a package update by clearing the `require.cache` object of all the paths related to the package.

data.title: Add "Yes for All" and "No for All" buttons to prompts from pane:close
data.body: When using the _pane:close_ command, if there're more than one unsaved items open in the pane, the save prompt will now display two additional buttons as seen in the GIF below: ![newbehavior](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9729792/11762937/65e86b6a-a0ef-11e5-8174-53c158f8bff6.gif) This also fixes an issue where using pane:close when only one pane exists makes atom prompt to save an unsaved item twice, as you can see below. The issue was verified on Windows, Mac and Linux. This was due to @promptToSaveItem being called twice in different methods in the case of there only being one pane. Also, thank you to @joaomnb for contributing to this new functionality.

data.title: Color picker returns invalid HEX string.
Pipe symbol subscript in Markdown mathmode syntax highlighting wrong
data.body:
Writing a pipe symbol followed by an underscore, `|_` (for subscript in math-mode) makes the syntax highlighter think any text after is emphasised. The highlighting can be escaped using two underscores, but I don't think this should happen in the first place (unless there is some reason I am not aware of yet).

![atom_markdown_highlighing_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1769386/11759700/d6ea2b5a-a0e5-11e5-9292-15dfbcf850f3.png)
